title: Akali has a 38% winrate mid
body:
GOOD
LEAVE HER THAT WAY
for at least 1-2 patches
Give people time to get used to her new skill oriented kit
THEN decide whether or not she needs buffs/changes

Don't hotfix her because her winrate is low
Give it a few weeks before we Aatrox her

replies.body:
38% is too low, though.

A small buff in the meantime (*not* large-scale, just a tiny one to her armor/mr/hp or whatever) wouldn't be the worst of ideas.

This is exactly the way Riot thinks when they see winrates of new champions
Aatrox's winrate was low on his release, and riot gave him a _TINY_ buff and his winrate skyrocketed
We just need to wait and see
The Aatrox buffs were far from tiny.  He got hotfixed twice in one patch with substantial buffs almost immediately after release.
After the boards and reddit squealed about how trash he was.

Aatrox NEEDED the buffs. The nerfs, for the most part, took power out that wasnt put in.

Akali likely needs the same.

Design wise, you want your champ to be a bit too good on release, and round out the champ taking power out as people get better. If the champ is just straight too weak, youll get no useful data other than needs buffs.

Why would you want your champion to be too good and get nerfed to feeling relatively worse?

Thats terrible planning.

I'd rather be weak or decent on release and receive QoL buffs for 5-6 years *cough*{{champion:90}}*cough*
Works much better for devs, as it allows them better information to fine tune whats needed.

We should wait for the winrate to stabilize before she's touched. Which would you rather happen: 
---
She's bad for a while then gets nudged up to around 50% winrate over the course of several patches {{champion:432}} 

or
She's bad on release, overbuffed, pick/ban in LCS, then gutted {{champion:516}} 
---
Besides, look at blade. Having no trouble making her work. A champion is truly garbage if blade struggles on it.
You ***do*** realize there is a middle ground between "overbuffing" and "Waiting 2 months before we change them", right?
That middle ground doesn't exist for riot, evidently xd

The problem with this logic is, if a new champion, or a champion who has been significantly changed/reworked has a low winrate, they are not likely to be played/mastered. Riot needs champions to be played in order to identify what aspects of a champion are too strong or too weak. The PBE does not accomplish this because there is no honest ranking system, and characters are not in beta long enough for them to really be mastered. The function of the beta environment is to be sure that the character functions properly.
Akali's playrate is still really high though

It is only the second day. 

My point is, Riot prefers that she is strong, or even overpowered, as opposed to weak .. or even balanced. 

A low winrate is bad for testing purposes because the community generally places a lot of stock in things like that. If a champion has a very low winrate, players are unlikely to even try to play or learn them because they prefer to win games.

This logic is killing the game though. Not only are they releasing more and more champions with toxic and frustrating to play against kits, but now we have to deal with them being completely bonkers too?
This is not a new concept. It isn't killing the game. They have done this as long as I've been playing.
Except newer champions have much more frustrating kits to play against. Look no further than Zoe and Camille

>
> Akali's playrate is still really high though

sry can't stop playing her
If it takes OPOP stats to make a champion want to be played, then the maker of the kit should be disappointed in themselves.
There are 141 champions. ...

And? That has nothing to do with making a kit and character that people can find enjoyable.

Unless you play all 141 champions each day.

Did you even read what I said earlier?? The whole point is for Riot to gather information on the champion's balance by having players play that champion frequently, giving them data to identify strengths and weaknesses, while taking into account a player's mastery of that champion (their pickrate with that champion) .. So it does matter because NO, most people do not play 141 champions every day, which is exactly why there needs to be an incentive for player to pick THIS ONE champion out of the 141 champions that they have the choice to pick from. Even if you look at the frequency of champions picked, there are champions who are so rarely picked because they are not strong in the meta. Think about the champions that you rarely see currently. A lot of them have low WINRATES so they have low PICKRATES. 

It doesn't matter if they have an enjoyable kit if people are not likely to win with them because people have a habit of playing to win, instead of playing for fun. Sad but true.

Then let me ask you this:

"Why does a champion have to be rebalanced with nerfs or buffs right after their release?"

I answered this already. The Public Beta Environment is meant to ensure that a champion's kit functions properly. It is not possible for Riot to get an accurate sense of the character's strengths and weaknesses when played competitively. This can only be evaluated after the champion has been released to live servers. The more this character is played, the more data they are able to collect, and the more accurately they are able to move the champion closer to balance.
Or, you know, Riot can actually TRY and aim for 50%?

not always, but usually. with the 8.16 tank changes i doubt she'll survive in top. she's too easy to destroy with 1 single ability.

I don't think her damage is the problem, as far as I know her base stats are quite low compared to old Akali. But I also just don't think Akali is even remotely weak or in need of any buffs at all right now, she's only been out for like 2 days and she is very hard as far as I can tell.

Tbh I got good games with akali but my problem is the early cd on the ult since you mostly rely on it to be able to gap close efficiency or to pick-up kills and for me to be able to play well akali it's needed for the player to know what to do with her. I think her winrate will raise soon even without buffs

Isn't her winrate low though because inexperienced players are trying her and there is a learning curve for Akali? So it would imply to be able to successfully "master" Akali, you'd have to play a set amount of games to get a feel for the champion with combos, etc. 

It wouldn't make sense to just outright buff her with so little time to accustom to her playstyle/abilities/combos. 

So uh.. yeah leave it that way xD

Thank God, after reading the title, I thought you were about to complain and ask for buffs. 

I agree on waiting at least 2-3 weeks before making adjustments. I mean, she might not need any

It's not even really damage thats the problem, her kit has awkward issues. Her energy cost on her q is really high and her regen is really low, so when you factor in how long it takes to get the heal from her q, it ends up being like 5-6 health a second. Then her q super short range and makes it really hard for her to deal with most mages, or anyone with aoe really. She's also super feast or famine.
If god is real and merciful she'll stay at a 38%wr for the duration of the game's lifespan.

diana litterally does what old akali did, and diana right now is simply better than new akali because of it. new akali  isnt bad, she just requires alot of set up compared to just Q+Ring someone to death. she needs to connect her entire kit of abilities to burst someone, but once people learn that she can just set up while in shroud she wont be able to be 1v1ed.

So many champs have suffered from the "New Champion Syndrome." I'm surprised Riot and the community haven't taken a hint yet. At this point, we shouldn't need topics like these to point us in the right direction.
Sounds perfect, I like her how she is, dont buff.

idc about the others but i like her that way she is
no changes needed imo

She needs her sustain changed. Before rework, you sustained in lane so that you could put pressure the enemy laner through multiple trades. She was also able to sustain in all in fights as a sort of drain tank type bruiser thing. Now her sustain is pretty shitty. Other than her sustain and energy usage i think she is fine.

Well, you could just stop banning new champions, then their winrate would stabilize much faster.
